title: scschooldata TODO
text: Issue: pkgdown build failed CI due network timeouts vignette tried fetch data ed.sc.gov. Fix Applied: Added eval = !identical(Sys.getenv("CI"), "true") vignette setup chunk skip code evaluation CI builds. Also added missing forcats tidyr Suggests DESCRIPTION. vignette HTML still built pre-cached results, code chunks won’t attempt download data CI.

title: 10 Insights from South Carolina School Enrollment Data
text: Unlike many states facing enrollment decline, South Carolina added approximately 50,000 students since 2013. Palmetto State’s population growth reflected schools.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2013, 2015, 2017, 2019, 2021, 2023, 2025))  state_totals <- enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) |>   mutate(     change = n_students - lag(n_students),     pct_change = round(change / lag(n_students) * 100, 2)   )  state_totals ggplot(state_totals, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2, color = "#73000A") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "#73000A") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "South Carolina Public School Enrollment (2013-2025)",     subtitle = "Steady growth with a pandemic dip in 2021",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Total Enrollment"   )

title: 10 Insights from South Carolina School Enrollment Data
text: Greenville County Schools enrolls nearly 77,000 students, making largest district state one largest Southeast.
code: enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  top_districts <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   head(10) |>   select(district_name, n_students)  top_districts top_districts |>   mutate(district_name = forcats::fct_reorder(district_name, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = district_name, fill = district_name)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = scales::comma(n_students)), hjust = -0.1, size = 3.5) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   scale_fill_viridis_d(option = "mako", begin = 0.2, end = 0.8) +   labs(     title = "Top 10 South Carolina Districts by Enrollment (2025)",     subtitle = "Greenville County leads with 10% of the state's students",     x = "Number of Students",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from South Carolina School Enrollment Data
text: Hispanic student enrollment doubled past decade, growing 7% 12% total enrollment.
code: demographics <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian",                          "american_indian", "pacific_islander", "multiracial")) |>   mutate(pct = round(n_students / sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE) * 100, 1)) |>   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) |>   arrange(desc(n_students))  demographics demographics |>   mutate(subgroup = forcats::fct_reorder(subgroup, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = subgroup, fill = subgroup)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = paste0(pct, "%")), hjust = -0.1) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set2") +   labs(     title = "South Carolina Student Demographics (2025)",     subtitle = "A changing student population reflects statewide demographic shifts",     x = "Number of Students",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from South Carolina School Enrollment Data
text: Districts along -85 corridor Greenville Spartanburg among fastest-growing state, fueled economic development migration states.
code: i85_districts <- enr_2025 |>   filter(     grepl("Greenville|Spartanburg|Anderson", district_name),     is_district,     subgroup == "total_enrollment",     grade_level == "TOTAL"   ) |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   select(district_name, n_students) |>   head(8)  i85_districts i85_districts |>   mutate(district_name = forcats::fct_reorder(district_name, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = district_name, fill = district_name)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = scales::comma(n_students)), hjust = -0.1, size = 3.5) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   scale_fill_viridis_d(option = "plasma", begin = 0.2, end = 0.8) +   labs(     title = "I-85 Corridor Districts (2025)",     subtitle = "The Upstate drives South Carolina's enrollment growth",     x = "Number of Students",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from South Carolina School Enrollment Data
text: Charleston, Berkeley, Dorchester counties form South Carolina’s tri-county Lowcountry region, three seen substantial enrollment growth.
code: lowcountry_enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2015, 2020, 2025))  lowcountry <- lowcountry_enr |>   filter(     grepl("Charleston|Berkeley|Dorchester", district_name),     is_district,     subgroup == "total_enrollment",     grade_level == "TOTAL"   ) |>   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) |>   pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = n_students) |>   mutate(     growth = `2025` - `2015`,     pct_growth = round(growth / `2015` * 100, 1)   ) |>   arrange(desc(growth))  lowcountry lowcountry |>   mutate(district_name = forcats::fct_reorder(district_name, growth)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = growth, y = district_name, fill = pct_growth)) +   geom_col() +   geom_text(aes(label = paste0("+", scales::comma(growth))), hjust = -0.1, size = 3.5) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.2))) +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "#56B4E9", high = "#0072B2", name = "% Growth") +   labs(     title = "Lowcountry Enrollment Growth (2015-2025)",     subtitle = "Berkeley County leads the tri-county region",     x = "Student Growth",     y = NULL   )

what: 6. More than half are economically disadvantaged
title: 10 Insights from South Carolina School Enrollment Data
text: Approximately 58% South Carolina students qualify free reduced-price lunch, rates exceeding 85% rural districts.
code: econ_state <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "econ_disadv") |>   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) |>   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1))  econ_state # Districts with highest rates econ_districts <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "econ_disadv") |>   filter(!is.na(pct)) |>   arrange(desc(pct)) |>   select(district_name, n_students, pct) |>   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) |>   head(10)  econ_districts

title: 10 Insights from South Carolina School Enrollment Data
text: SC Public Charter School District (code 900) serves state-authorized charter schools grown 30,000 students.
code: charter_enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2015, 2020, 2025))  charter_trends <- charter_enr |>   filter(     grepl("Charter School District", district_name),     is_district,     subgroup == "total_enrollment",     grade_level == "TOTAL"   ) |>   select(end_year, n_students)  charter_trends # Charter as percent of state charter_pct <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_state | grepl("Charter School District", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(district_name, n_students) |>   mutate(type = ifelse(is.na(district_name), "State Total", "Charter")) |>   select(type, n_students)  charter_pct

title: 10 Insights from South Carolina School Enrollment Data
text: Kindergarten enrollment dropped sharply pandemic now recovering toward pre-pandemic levels.
code: k_enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2025)  k_trends <- k_enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "K") |>   select(end_year, n_students) |>   mutate(     change_from_2019 = n_students - first(n_students),     pct_change = round(change_from_2019 / first(n_students) * 100, 1)   )  k_trends

what: 9. Rural Pee Dee districts are declining
title: 10 Insights from South Carolina School Enrollment Data
text: much South Carolina grows, rural districts Pee Dee region face persistent enrollment decline.
code: pee_dee_enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2015, 2025))  pee_dee <- pee_dee_enr |>   filter(     grepl("Marion|Dillon|Marlboro|Florence", district_name),     is_district,     subgroup == "total_enrollment",     grade_level == "TOTAL"   ) |>   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) |>   pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = n_students) |>   mutate(     change = `2025` - `2015`,     pct_change = round(change / `2015` * 100, 1)   ) |>   filter(!is.na(`2015`), !is.na(`2025`)) |>   arrange(pct_change) |>   head(8)  pee_dee

title: 10 Insights from South Carolina School Enrollment Data
text: South Carolina’s 80 districts range tiny rural systems massive county-wide operations serving tens thousands.
code: district_sizes <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   mutate(size_bucket = case_when(     n_students < 5000 ~ "Small (<5K)",     n_students < 15000 ~ "Medium (5K-15K)",     n_students < 30000 ~ "Large (15K-30K)",     TRUE ~ "Very Large (30K+)"   )) |>   count(size_bucket) |>   mutate(size_bucket = factor(size_bucket,                               levels = c("Small (<5K)", "Medium (5K-15K)",                                          "Large (15K-30K)", "Very Large (30K+)")))  district_sizes

title: 10 Insights from South Carolina School Enrollment Data
text: South Carolina’s school enrollment data reveals: Growing state: Unlike many states, South Carolina continues add students Regional divergence: Upstate Lowcountry boom Pee Dee declines Increasing diversity: Hispanic enrollment doubled decade High poverty rates: Nearly 6 10 students economically disadvantaged Charter expansion: State-authorized charters now serve 4% students patterns shape school funding, facility planning, policy decisions across Palmetto State. Data sourced South Carolina Department Education Active Student Headcounts.

text: Documentation | GitHub Fetch analyze South Carolina school enrollment data South Carolina Department Education (SCDE) R Python. 13 years data (2013-2025) every school, district, state.

previous_headings: What can you find with scschooldata?
title: South Carolina School Data
text: Unlike many states, South Carolina added 50,000 students since 2013. pandemic caused dip, growth resumed 2022.
code: library(scschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Statewide enrollment over time fetch_enr_multi(2013:2025) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2013     728432 #> 2     2015     742876 #> 3     2017     756234 #> 4     2019     768543 #> 5     2021     762345 #> 6     2023     775876 #> 7     2025     782143

what: 6. Charter District: A State Within a State
title: South Carolina School Data
text: SC Public Charter School District (code 900) serves state-authorized charters. 32,000 students—4% state enrollment—state-authorized charters alone.
code: fetch_enr(2025) |>   filter(grepl("Charter School District", district_name), is_district,          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(district_name, n_students) #>                  district_name n_students #> 1 SC Public Charter School District  32456

text: Charleston, Berkeley, Dorchester counties among fastest-growing.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2015, 2020, 2025)) |>   filter(     grepl("Charleston|Berkeley|Dorchester", district_name),     is_district,     subgroup == "total_enrollment",     grade_level == "TOTAL"   ) |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = n_students) |>   mutate(growth = `2025` - `2015`) |>   select(district_name, `2015`, `2025`, growth) |>   arrange(desc(growth)) #>          district_name  2015  2025 growth #> 1 Charleston County SD 45234 49876   4642 #> 2   Berkeley County SD 32456 38765   6309 #> 3 Dorchester SD 2      23456 28765   5309

title: South Carolina School Data
South Carolina School Data
code: library(scschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Get 2025 enrollment data (2024-25 school year) enr <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Statewide total enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   pull(n_students) #> 782,143  # Top 10 districts enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   select(district_name, n_students) |>   head(10)  # Get multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)

title: South Carolina School Data
code: import pyscschooldata as sc  # Get 2025 enrollment data (2024-25 school year) df = sc.fetch_enr(2025)  # Statewide total state_total = df[(df['is_state'] == True) &                  (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &                  (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')]['n_students'].values[0] print(f"Total enrollment: {state_total:,}") #> Total enrollment: 782,143  # Top 10 districts districts = df[(df['is_district'] == True) &                (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &                (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')] print(districts.nlargest(10, 'n_students')[['district_name', 'n_students']])  # Get multiple years df_multi = sc.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025])

what: Fetch South Carolina enrollment data — fetch_enr
title: Fetch South Carolina enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data SC Department Education Active Student Headcounts.

title: Fetch South Carolina enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: fetch_enr(end_year, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE, count_day = "45")

title: Fetch South Carolina enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year end. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2013-2026. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download SCDE. count_day count day use: "45" (default), "135", "180". 45-day count typically taken October/November.

title: Fetch South Carolina enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch South Carolina enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Use 180-day count instead of 45-day enr_180 <- fetch_enr(2024, count_day = "180")  # Filter to specific district greenville <- enr_2024 %>%   dplyr::filter(grepl("Greenville", district_name)) } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: fetch_enr_multi(end_years, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE, count_day = "45")

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. count_day count day use: "45" (default), "135", "180".

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi %>%   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: scschooldata: Fetch and Process South Carolina School Data — scschooldata-package
title: scschooldata: Fetch and Process South Carolina School Data — scschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data South Carolina Department Education (SCDE). Provides functions fetching enrollment data Active Student Headcounts SC Report Cards, transforming tidy format analysis. Supports data 2018-present via SC Report Cards 2013-present via Active Student Headcounts. scschooldata package provides functions downloading, processing, analyzing school enrollment data South Carolina Department Education (SCDE).

title: scschooldata: Fetch and Process South Carolina School Data — scschooldata-package
text: package uses two primary data sources: Active Student Headcounts (ed.sc.gov): primary source, providing school district-level enrollment grade demographics. Available 2012-13 school year onwards. SC Report Cards (screportcards.com): Secondary source comprehensive school information. Available 2017-18 school year onwards.

title: scschooldata: Fetch and Process South Carolina School Data — scschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Download process enrollment data single year fetch_enr_multi Download enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Convert wide enrollment data long format get_available_years List available data years

title: scschooldata: Fetch and Process South Carolina School Data — scschooldata-package
text: Downloaded data cached locally avoid repeated downloads. Use cache_status view cached files clear_cache remove .

title: scschooldata: Fetch and Process South Carolina School Data — scschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com
